title.rendered: Konami’s Castlevania 35th Anniversary NFT Auction Ends With Over $160,000 Raised

content.rendered:
One of the most surprising news that 2022 began with was the fact that Konami signed up for this whole thing. of NFTs, which is gaining more and more popularity due to the fact that the number of video game companies that are betting on them is increasing little by little over the weeks.

In the case of Konami decided to carry out an auction of NFTs from the Castlevania saga on the occasion of its 35th anniversary, which, as announced, took place this week. A total of 14 digital pieces have been enabled in it in the form of art images and melodies from various titles of the franchise and have ended up selling for about 12,000 dollars (about 10,500 euros) on average.

Specifically, the piece of art that has sold for the greatest amount of money corresponds to the map of Dracula’s castle from the first Castlevania of the series, whose price has reached $26,539 (about 23,200 euros). The following was a three minute video of various Castlevaniareaching 17,518 dollars (about 15,300 euros), while an art image of Castlevania: Circle of the Moon It has been sold for 17,000 dollars (about 14,890 euros).

Total Konami has managed to raise more than 162,000 dollars (about 141,900 euros), of which the OpenSea platform, where the auction was held, has kept a 2.5% commission for the different transactions. On the other hand, the winners of the auction will see how their names will remain reflected on the website dedicated to these NFTs from February until the end of 2022.

Konami already dropped that the Castlevania Memorial NFT initiative would be just the first of others that he does not rule out carrying out related to these products, so it would not be unreasonable to think that at some point this year other auctions will end up taking place, seeing the success that this one has had.
